titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: Compiled by Martha Bunting at the request of C. Gilbert Bunting of England.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of information on the descendants of Anthony Bunting, a Quaker, and his wife Ellen Barker of Matlocks, Derbyshire, England (married 1641). Genealogical research materials include: notes; extracts from published and primary sources; narrative; correspondence related to the research; printed materials (including 1936 Philadelphia Record and Inquirer rotogravure sections); and photocopies from printed materials. There are a few original records such as a passport and photographs.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
